image.altText: Bruce Lehrmann walks away as a TV camera films him.

props.synopsis: With his defamation appeal dismissed and legal costs rising, Bruce Lehrmann is almost out of options. A High Court bid is possible, but what would it take to get there?

title.children: Bruce Lehrmann is running out of courts to continue his legal battle

image.altText: A Qantas Boeing 737-800 aircraft is seen landing at Sydney Domestic Airport

props.synopsis: A data-entry mistake by a Qantas employee set off a series of errors that caused a Boeing 737 to take off slower than it should have.

title.children: Typing error 'cascaded' into series of mistakes on Qantas flight

image.altText: A man with dark hair and glasses in a suit.

props.synopsis: Bruce Lehrmann has lost his appeal against a Federal Court ruling that found, on the balance of probabilities, he raped his then-colleague Brittany Higgins in 2019.

title.children: Bruce Lehrmann may turn to High Court following appeal loss: lawyer

image.altText: A person in an Akubra hat silhouetted against an Indigenous flag.

props.synopsis: Senior ACT public servants will soon be required to demonstrate their work towards ending the inequality experienced by First Nations people.

title.children: ACT public servants legally required to uphold 'Closing the Gap principle'

image.altText: Woman in long blue dress smiles at camera in the doorway of her shop front

props.synopsis: Frustrated retailers grappling with online shoplifters are calling for better protections from banks, payment providers and regulators.

title.children: 'It's theft': The online shoppers receiving their orders then claiming refunds

image.altText: A woman with red hair pulled back stands outdoors speaking seriously.

props.synopsis: ACT Attorney-General Tara Cheyne is found to have breached the code of conduct for a parliamentarian over an anonymous text message she sent criticising former Canberra Liberals leader Elizabeth Lee.

title.children: ACT minister's text criticising backbencher breached code of conduct

image.altText: The sign for School of Music adorns a concrete building, winter trees in the foreground.

props.synopsis: The Australian National University has abandoned a controversial plan to absorb its School of Music into a single course after extraordinary public pressure.

title.children: ANU backflips on plan to axe the School of Music after public pressure

image.altText: 25-year-old Canberra man charged with multiple counts of dangerous driving

props.synopsis: A Canberra man has been jailed over a string of road rage attacks committed "for trivial reasons", and fined $10,000 for performing a Nazi salute outside a Queensland synagogue.

title.children: Canberra man who performed Nazi salute jailed over road rage incidents

image.altText: Hundreds of overflowing cardboard boxes full of donated second-hand items in a large warehouse.

props.synopsis: Canberra's biggest charities dumped almost 600 tonnes of waste last financial year, with the declining quality of donations a key factor in goods ending up as landfill.

title.children: Vinnies takes most waste to ACT landfill as overall charity waste declines

image.altText: An old woman and man, both wearing glasses, sit on chairs around a round wooden table

props.synopsis: The family of the late first wife of High Country killer Greg Lynn says a fresh investigation into her death has stalled because police won't pay for an expert report.

title.children: Fresh probe into Lisa Lynn's death stalls over $9,000 bill, family says

image.altText: A group of wind turbines dotted along a hillside against a hazy blue sky

props.synopsis: An energy watchdog says more renewable energy is projected to lower prices, but others warn the promise is illusory and more pain is coming.

title.children: Watchdog flags 5 per cent fall in power prices amid renewables surge

image.altText: A composite of Volodymyr Zelenskyy and Vladimir Putin.

props.synopsis: After a flurry of meetings, Russia's war in Ukraine continues. So where is the peace process at?

title.children: Here's what experts say about the Russia–Ukraine peace process

image.altText: aa middle aged man with greying hair and glasses

props.synopsis: A California doctor is imprisoned for illegally supplying Friends sitcom star Matthew Perry with ketamine, the powerful sedative that caused the actor's drug overdose death in 2023.

title.children: Doctor in Matthew Perry overdose case jailed

image.altText: A pencil drawing of a man surrounded by a vortex of redress scheme forms

props.synopsis: An independent audit of the National Redress Scheme has found wait times are increasing and causing significant distress to survivors of child sexual abuse.

title.children: Child sexual abuse victims face anxious wait for redress via official scheme

image.altText: Tony Burke makes an address.

props.synopsis: Opposition Leader Sussan Ley says the Coalition does not support the return of women who were taken to Syria as partners of Islamic State members, and says the home affairs minister needs to answer questions about why he held a meeting with Save the Children.

title.children: Coalition urges Burke to explain meeting ahead of women returning from Syria

image.altText: kevin wife homecare yard

props.synopsis: Care providers are trying to strongarm cash from suppliers of equipment, including wheelchairs, a month after the federal government reformed home care packages for senior Australians.

title.children: 'It's borderline illegal': The battle raging on the home care front

image.altText: An image showing a man holding a phone. An image of a woman is reflected in his glasses.

props.synopsis: Confronting accounts give a rare insight into the minds of perpetrators of deepfake image-based abuse, as part of a landmark study.

title.children: 'A little bit of revenge': Offenders give insight into deepfake image abuse

image.altText: Hong Kong fire

props.synopsis: Authorities are continuing to probe the blaze at the Wang Fuk Court complex, which killed at least 159 people last week.

title.children: Six people arrested for deactivating fire alarms at Hong Kong fire site

image.altText: A Shanghai arena sits deserted as Japanese cultural events face sudden cancellations.

props.synopsis: Beijing halts more than 20 Japanese cultural events across China as its diplomatic spat with Japan escalates.

title.children: Japan's pop queen sings to 14,000 empty seats amid Beijing crackdown

image.altText: Black and white image of Jimmy Barnes in a white singlet in an open space staring at the camera.

props.synopsis: Cold Chisel was over. America beckoned. And Jimmy Barnes was terrified. This is the story of the album that made him, and the song that saved him.

title.children: Jimmy Barnes's American gamble didn't pay off — but he has no regrets

image.altText: Travis Head looks over his shoulder as he completes a shot.

props.synopsis: The second Ashes Test is upon us and we have fingers crossed it will last more than two days. Here's everything you need to know.

title.children: What time does the Gabba Test start and everything else you need to know

image.altText: Hand holding a magnifying glass over Tasmanian Government letterhead.

props.synopsis: Tasmania's premier and treasurer agree to reduce borrowings for government businesses in an effort to accommodate more debt for the Hobart AFL stadium.

title.children: Cutbacks, revenue raising in line to help fund Hobart AFL stadium

image.altText: A sun burning bright in an orange sky above clouds on the horizon.

props.synopsis: Temperatures are set to soar in parts of Victoria today after a wintry start to the season earlier this week.

title.children: Victoria on fire alert as temperatures hit high 30s after cold start to summer

image.altText: gold coast beach

props.synopsis: Severe erosion caused by Cyclone Alfred forced the closure of several beaches in March. Now, extra lifeguards are being recruited as they anticipate a busy summer period.

title.children: Gold Coast beaches all open in time for summer holidays

image.altText: Aerial shot of cars

props.synopsis: A man is charged with murder after a shooting on the coast of northern NSW that left one man dead and two others injured.

title.children: Man charged with murder over shooting on NSW North Coast

image.altText: A close-up of Donald Trump smiling.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump says his country is at war with "narco-terrorists". But he is freeing the former president of Honduras, who was jailed in the US for overseeing one of the world's worst drug conspiracies.

title.children: What led Trump to free a president jailed for flooding the US with drugs

image.altText: A For Lease sign advertising a rental property in Carlton North.

props.synopsis: A new report finds that about 70 per cent of renters were avoiding heating and cooling their homes to save money. Some experts and advocates are calling for stronger minimum energy standards across the country.

title.children: Most renters avoid heating and cooling homes due to costs

image.altText: Matthew Hickey in suit walks into court.

props.synopsis: Brisbane-based lawyer Matthew Hickey has been quietly facing a tax fight, with the Australian Taxation Office (ATO) bill now sitting at about $2.7 million.

title.children: How a legal silk chalked up a $2.7m default tax bill

image.altText: Towers at an oil refinery.

props.synopsis: With just two refineries left and 80 per cent of liquid fuel being imported, experts are warning Australia is increasingly vulnerable to global supply shocks.

title.children: Fuel security warning as Australia's oil reserves fall short of global standards

image.altText: Women and children with bags of belongings sit in the back of  a truck moving through a desert area.

props.synopsis: Israeli authorities have announced the Rafah border crossing from Gaza into Egypt will open "in coming days," but only for Palestinians wanting to leave the war-ravaged strip.

title.children: Rafah crossing will open to let Gazans cross into Egypt

image.altText: Two people in front of a large modular home, which is sitting on the back of a truck, waving in celebration.

props.synopsis: A one-of-a-kind home, designed with the input of Tennant Creek families, has rolled up the Stuart Highway from Adelaide on a convoy of trucks. It is part of a new initiative aiming to transform housing in remote First Nations communities.

title.children: Home designed by Tennant Creek residents to live 'our way' arrives on truck

image.altText: A crowd of people carrying umbrellas and shopping bags walk along a street on a rainy day.

props.synopsis: Australia's latest economic growth numbers show an economy in generally rude health, but that might result in a rude shock for mortgage borrowers earlier rather than later in 2026.

title.children: GDP figures a beautiful set of numbers with a sting in the tail

image.altText: Little boy, little girl and their mum hug with Christmas tree in background

props.synopsis: When seven-month-old Evelyn was diagnosed with a rare cancer, her mother was told proton beam therapy would be her daughter's best chance for survival. But the treatment was not available in Australia and still is not three years later.

title.children: Mother's fight for proton therapy highlights gaps in Australia's care

image.altText: woman curled up in white bed linen asleep

props.synopsis: What you wear to bed can affect the quality of your sleep. And if that's nothing at all, there are a few things to consider.

title.children: Is it better to sleep naked or wear pyjamas?

image.altText: Six members of rock band Foo Fighters stand side-by-side, smiling.

props.synopsis: Tasmania's "biggest concert ever" will take place at Launceston's York Park next month when American rock band Foo Fighters play their only Australian show.

title.children: Tasmania to pay $650,000 for Foo Fighters concert in Launceston
